results.title: Sergeant Swell of the Mounties
results.creator_credit: Pending Productions, Len Janson and Chuck Menville
results.brief_description: A spoof on the Royal Canadian Mounted Police in which our hero, Sergeant Swell, finds himself at odds with a local Indian tribe and a warrior who always seems to be just a few steps behind. Includes the ‘cliche’ lady in perpetual distress who requires continuous rescuing by the incompetent Swell.

results.title: Serenal
results.brief_description:
A vibrant fantasia of patterned sound in which Norman McLaren salutes the West Indies, painting the spirit of fiesta on film to the lively beat of an island tune by Trinidad’s Grand Curacaya Orchestra.
(Awards: San Sebastian; Bilbao; Bergamo.)

results.title: Serenade
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and Anthony Mann
results.brief_description: A musical feast for lovers of opera and fans of tenor Mario Lanza. Lanza plays Damon Vincenti, an unknown tenor who is plucked from obscurity when he is discovered by society patroness Kendall Hale (Joan Fontaine). With smooth impresario Charles Winthrop (Vincent Price) and voice teacher Maestro Marcatello (Joseph Calleia) behind him Vincenti is on the road to a great career as a tenor, but he becomes mesmerised by Kendall Hale. Hale has already had a string of heartbroken men who have been her pet projects in the past, and Damon is set to be her next victim. On the night of his debut at the New York Opera she drops him for her next protege. Damon is devastated and flees in the middle of his debut. He escapes to Mexico and is unable to sing. He is ‘rescued’ by Juana Montes (Sara Montiel) a fiery but patient Mexican girl whose father was a bull fighter. Eventually Damon marries Juana and they head back to America to restart his career. A showdown between the two women is set up as they fight over Vincenti. Fans of Lanza’s voice will appreciate the numerous songs he sings in this film, including “Serenade”,”Ave Maria” and “Nessun Dorma”.

results.title: Serama's mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Saltzman and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”
Serama, a Balinese boy, has been learning the intricate, ancient art of the Balinese dance since he was seven. His teacher is his father, a master dancer. They practice for a dance that will be the father’s final performance, and mark his son as his replacement.

results.title: Sequences of behavior (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Behavior Theory in Practice”.
Shows procedure for conditioning homogeneous and heterogeneous behaviour chains. Demonstrates shaping of complex behaviour chains in pigeons, dogs in obedience trials, police dogs and guide dogs, showing practical application of laboratory findings

results.title: Sequence and story
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Johnson and Don White
results.brief_description:
In this film a group of children manipulate reality using a series of photographs of their own activities. As they lay out the photos in different sequences, the story of their day changes. Simple, realistic dialogue and a combination of live action and still photographs capture the viewer’s imagination.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Sequel to Surtsey
results.brief_description: Shows the volcanic activity of the island of Surtsey near Iceland throughout 1965-l966. Submarine eruptions create the temporary neighbouring islands of Syrtlingur and Jolnir, reduced to shoals soon after they cease erupting. After a quiescent period new eruptions begin on Surtsey itself. Meanwhile scientific investigations continue, a permanent base is established and plant life appears. A continuation of the film Birth of an Island (502828).

results.title: September 11 news footage
results.brief_description: The world held its breath as two hijacked planes were crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on 11 September 2001. TV networks around the world bore witness and millions of people saw the historic event unfold in real time.
results.description: The world held its breath as two hijacked planes were crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on 11 September 2001. TV networks around the world bore witness and millions of people saw the historic event unfold in real time.

results.title: September '51
results.creator_credit: Australian Film and Television School and Raymond Quint
results.brief_description:
Looks at the Menzies LCP government’s attempt to ban the Communist Party in Australia in the referendum of 1951 through the dramatic portrayal of the life of a young couple who are members of the party. Highlights the near hysterical atmosphere of this period in Australia’s history.
Cast includes Martin Vaughn, Barry Otto and John Howard.
